ACT
1651.  
Implementation of Regulation (EU) 2020/1783 of the European Parliament and of the Council
In the succession proceedings, an Estonian notary is deemed to be a court within the meaning of Article 2(1) of Regulation (EU) 2020/1783 of the European Parliament and of the Council on cooperation between the courts of the Member States in the taking of evidence in civil or commercial matters (taking of evidence) (OJ L 405, 02.12.2020, p. 1–39).
The provisions of this Act apply to the provision of assistance in taking of evidence in another Member State of the European Union at the request of an Estonian notary in succession proceedings conducted by the notary to the extent not provided otherwise by Regulation (EU) 2020/1783 of the European Parliament and of the Council.
Taking of evidence in another Member State of the European Union takes place pursuant to the procedure provided in Regulation (EU) 2020/1783 of the European Parliament and of the Council with the assistance of a court of the other Member State, or directly.
